intro: Tournefortia ulei, commonly known as the African star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and elliptical with a smooth surface. Tournefortia ulei thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens.
